Description.val:
The Satellite Communications (SATCOM) Systems P-1 line provides funds for procurement of shipboard terminal equipment for ship-to-ship, ship-to-shore and ship-to-aircraft tactical communications via earth orbiting relay satellites.   This includes Radio Frequency (RF) equipment and baseband equipment assembled and grouped into systems and subsystems structured to address specific naval communications requirements.   These systems provide modem processors and peripheral equipment that control the RF links for message traffic, direct data transfer and secure voice communications.  They are selected and oriented by communications traffic levels, types of communications and operational missions. Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) technical refresh of system modems and Ka Kits will directly support Assured Command and Control (AC2) posture, SATCOM reliability, space resiliency via band diversity and redundancy.  AC2 modems enable the use of Wideband Global Satellite (WGS) X-Band (ship/submarine transmit and receive) and Ka-band (shore receive and transmit) resources to maintain link connectivity to provide assured access to mission critical communications in Anti-Access Anti-Denial (A2AD) jamming environments.

[P5 / (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite Assured C2 Modems]: CBSP Assured C2 Modems:  Directly support Assured Command and Control (C2) posture, SATCOM reliability, space resiliency via band diversity and redundancy for MILSATCOM. 
 
FY20 continues the procurement of modems and peripheral equipment to the CBSP terminal to provide technology refresh and directly support Assured Command and Control (C2) communications.

[P5 / (NR112) CBSP Ka Kits]: CBSP KA Kits:  Current National focus is on highly contested environments and has highlighted a growing need of protected communications, specifically in a satellite denied environment. Assured Command and Control (AC2) Ka Band Kits will increase band diversity and access to Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) and mitigates risk of loss of Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) wideband communications in a SATCOM-denied environment for the CBSP Program. With this capability, CBSP will be able to reduce risk of loss of C2 communications on Unit Level Variant (ULV)/ Field Level Variant (FLV) class Combatant ships in a denied environment which would assure Command and Control (C2) including ISR, NIPR/SIPR, VTC, and other critical capabilities.

In FY20, CBSP continues the procurement and installation of 2 ULV Ka Band Kits.

[P3A / (NR117) Global Broadcast Service (GBS)]: GLOBAL BROADCAST SERVICE (GBS - NR117): GBS is a Joint Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) program with the Air Force as Executive Agent for all services. GBS provides a continuous, high speed, one way information flow of high volume data to units ashore, afloat or special operations. GBS supports routine operations, training and military exercises, special activities, crises, situational awareness, weapons targeting, and reconnaissance. Deployment of GBS internet protocol (IP) terminals will allow expanded use of military intelligence collection in a broader spectrum using MILSATCOM architecture. The Navy GBS Split IP effort enables near-real-time duplex asymmetric communications connectivity to ships/subs. GBS plays a pivotal role to support the Assured Command and Control (AC2) environment.

[P3A - 2 / (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite program (CBSP) - Afloat]: CBSP is the U.S. Navy next generation Commercial Satellite Communications (SATCOM) program that provides the only source of wideband SATCOM to Patrol Coastal (PC) and Mine Countermeasure (MCM) Ships, diversity for Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) on Unit Level Variant (ULV) ships, and augments MILSATCOM on Force Level Variant (FLV) ships. CBSP will support the procurement and installation of a commercial terminal and service architecture that significantly increase data throughput, Navy A2AD posture, and communication reliability.  CBSP also increases space resiliency by providing band diversity, assured access, and redundancy for MILSATCOM. Included in the program are Small Ship Variant (SSV - Patrol Coastal and Mine Countermeasure Ships), Unit Level Variant (ULV - including Guided Missile Destroyers and Guided Missile Frigates), and Force Level Variant (FLV - large combatant ships including Carriers).

Justification.val:
The FY20 funding request increases meet Assured Command and Control (AC2) requirements for Global Broadcast System (GBS) Afloat Terminals and Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) Terminals.  Specifically, the GBS AC2 increase resides in the Engineering Change Order (ECO) and adds X-Band reception to provide coverage to Naval Forces when Ka-band beam coverage is not available or to support higher priority missions.  The ECO procures hardware, engineering services and installations to support critical X-Band capability to the Fleet.  CBSP increase provides an additional commercial Teleport Shore Site to support surge capacity and enable a worldwide, end-to-end AC2 capability for surface combatants, Military Sealift Command (MSC) ships, submarines, shore facilities and expeditionary forces.   

The FY20 funding request continues procurement of both Afloat and Portable Global Broadcast System (GBS) Program Receive Terminals and an Engineering Change Order (ECO) to meet the Navy's Microsoft Windows 10 requirement Cyber Security Mandate (dated 08 December 2016).  The ECO procures Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) hardware, engineering services and installations to support critical information assurance to the Fleet. 

The FY20 funding request continues Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) procurement and installation of Unit Level Variant (ULV) and Force Level Variant (FLV) Terminals.  Continues procurement and installation of CBSP modem technical refresh and begins procurement and installation of Ka Kit upgrades.  All of which are in direct support of Assured Command and Control (AC2) U.S. Navy afloat mission objectives.

Name.@footnote: Consolidated Prior Year Requirements costs of $911,688K which includes GBS Modem Upgrades, GBS Interim Modem Upgrades, GBS Shore Pre-Installation Design, SHF, NESP, CBSP, and Spectral Warrior (SW) / Spider Net (SN),JMINI Control System shore and JMINI CS Shore install dollars.
[NR118 Hardware] Funding supports procurement of mission related JMINI CS equipment at new NCTAMS Atlantic facility.

Name.val: (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite Assured C2 Modems

Name.@footnote: 1. FY20 CBSP AC2 Modem Qty 12 procurements and installations provides for a single Commercial Teleport Shore Site.  Qty 40 modem procurements and installations support Afloat units comprising of Force Level and Unit Level ship variants.

Name.val: 4.1.2) Assured C2 Modem Upgrades - Not Installed

Name.@footnote: FY19-20 CBSP Ka-Kit Unit Level Variant (ULV) procurement and installation Average Unit Costs (AUC) changes from PB 19 reflect accurate cost estimates derived from completed NRE efforts.  Increased procurement AUC is due to the cost of back-fitting CBSP Terminal Unit Level Variant (ULV) with a less costly installation.    FY20 supports the procurement and installation of 2 Unit Level Variant Ka Kits in an effort to reduce risk of loss of C2 communications on Unit Level Variant (ULV) class Combatant ships in a denied environment which would assure Command and Control (C2).

Name.val: 6.5) MILCON P-913 Shore Based Enterprise Network Enhancements-Organic

Name.@footnote: DSA estimates are based off a percentage of the total installation cost with 75% of costs required the year prior to Installation for design planning work and 25% required the year of the actual installation. The DSA increase from FY19 to FY20 is a result of an increase of the number installations from Qty 7 in FY19 to Qty 13 in FY20, an increase of Qty 6 installations planned in FY20.  The DSA cost variance are also attributed to the type of ship configuration being installed.

Engineering Change Order (ECO) is required to implement Cybersecurity upgrades to increase system performance for fielded GBS Afloat Receive Terminals and Portable Receive Terminals. FY18-20 procures and installs Win 10 PKI upgrades and performs associated integration, assembly and test.

1.  FY 2019 to FY 2020 GBS Afloat Receive Terminal Procurement and Installation increase is required to meet fielding requirements for Resilient Command and Control (RC2) that provides support to Fleet missions: Strike & Special Operations, Imagery and Intel Data (Live Streaming Video).
1.  GBS Portable Receive Terminals are turn-key and therefore do not have installation costs associated with them.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Afloat Receive Terminal

Description.val: GLOBAL BROADCAST SERVICE (GBS - NR117): GBS is a Joint Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) program with the Air Force as Executive Agent for all services.  GBS provides a continuous, high speed, one way information flow of high volume data to units ashore, afloat or special operations.  GBS supports routine operations, training and military exercises, special activities, crises, situational awareness, weapons targeting, and reconnaissance.  Deployment of GBS internet protocol (IP) terminals will allow expanded use of military intelligence collection in a broader spectrum using MILSATCOM architecture. The Navy GBS Split IP effort enables near-real-time duplex asymmetric communications connectivity to ships/subs.  GBS plays a pivotal role to support the AC2 environment.

Name.@footnote: Engineering changes required to implement bandwidth efficiency technologies to increase system performance for fielded Small Ship Variants (SSV) and Force Level Variants (FLV).

DSA estimates are based off of a percentage of the total installation, with 75% of costs being required the year prior  for all pre-installation design work and 25% required the year of the actual installation.

1.  FY19-FY24 Engineering Change Order (ECO) updates are re-prioritized to adjudicate FY19-FY24 CBSP Terminal Install and DSA funding levels required to complete scheduled installations to reflect updated fielding plan synchronization.  2.  FY20 installation cost increase compared to FY19 is driven by CBSP shipboard configuration type and platform type.  3.  FY20 procures Qty 5 CBSP Unit Level Variant (ULV) terminals to meet DDG ship class fielding requirements.
1.  Force Level Variant (FLV) terminals include single and dual antenna configurations which influences average unit cost.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Tiger Team:: Installation Name: Small Ship Variant (SSV), Unit Level Variant (ULV) and Force Level V

CBSP will support the procurement and installation of a commercial terminal and service architecture that significantly increase data throughput, Navy A2AD posture, and communication reliability.  CBSP also increases space resiliency by providing band diversity, assured access, and redundancy for MILSATCOM. Included in the program are Small Ship Variant (SSV - Patrol Coastal and Mine Countermeasure Ships), Unit Level Variant (ULV - including Guided Missile Destroyers and Guided Missile Frigates), and Force Level Variant (FLV - large combatant ships including Carriers).
